title: The Dow Rose 69 Points Because Soft Jobs Data Don’t Matter When Everyone’s Working
text:
Staying Aloft. Two out of the three major U.S. stock indexes closed with slight gains, while the third ended slightly in the red. Concerns about trade conflicts have been dormant, but the U.S. economy added fewer jobs than expected in August. Remarks by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell didn’t change investors’ views about the future path for interest rates. In today’s After the Bell, we...

check on the August jobs report; explain the nuances of the U.S. labor market; and wonder whether the Fed will change its mind about rate cuts at the coming September meeting.

...
